name: Another Mixture of General Knowledge Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is the hardest substance in the human body?
questions.correct: Enamel & tooth & teeth & tooth enamel & teeth enamel
questions.explanation:
Enamel & tooth & teeth & tooth enamel & teeth enamel.

	Tooth enamel is harder than finger nails, cartilege or bone.

questions.text: In the UK, for which of the following do you NOT need a license?
questions.explanation:
Dog.

	Dog licenses were abolished in the 1980s. TV licenses are {mandatory;} the license fee helps fund the BBC.

questions.text: Where is the island of Gozo?
questions.explanation:
Mediterranean.

	Gozo is near Malta in the Mediterranean

questions.text: What do the English towns Buxton, Cheltenham, Leamington, Bath and Harrogate have in common?
questions.explanation:
Spas.

	Bath has an Abbey, Cheltenham a racecourse but they are all spa towns, hence Bath's name.

questions.text: In what field is Simon Schama a popular academic?
questions.explanation:
History.

	Schama is currently presenting a landmark history of England on BBC television.

questions.text: Which London railway station gives its name to a children's favourite?
questions.explanation:
Paddington.

	Paddington Bear in the children's stories of the same name, is named after Paddington station where he was found. Victoria was a Queen, Waterloo a battle and an Abba song.

questions.text: Who was the second husband of Princess Anne, daughter of Queen Elizabeth II?
questions.explanation:
Cmdr Timothy Laurence.

	Mark Phillips was her first husband. Robert Fellowes was the Queen's secretary and married to a sister of Princess Diana. Sir Angus Ogilvy is married to the Queen's cousin Princess Alexandra.

questions.text: Who was Formula 1 World Champion in 1993?
questions.explanation:
Alain Prost.

	A rare French victory!

questions.text: Which controversial novel was published in 1988, forcing the author into seclusion?
questions.explanation:
Satanic Verses & The Satanic Verses.

	Salman Rushdie's novel was taken by some Muslims as blasphemous. The Ayatollah Khomeini pronounced a fatwah or death sentence on Rushdie.

questions.text: What would you do with a woggle?
questions.explanation:
Wear it.

	Wear it - it is the name of the scarf ring worn by Scouts and Guides.
